sentences.sContent: The doctor had encountered several similar cases in the past.
sentences.sCn: 那位医生过去曾碰到过好几个类似病例。

sentences.sContent: ...Well we'd been led to believe that we would encounter a good proportion of this older...
...participants were less likely to have had an encounter with the juvenile justice system...
...There is no denying that we will encounter many problems in our life...

...When these students encounter a new problem of the same type on a test- they're able to transfer the knowledge they've gathered more effectively than those who were the passive recipients of someone else's expertise...
...What does the speaker say about people who encounter stress once in a while...

remMethod.val: en(使…) ＋ counter(相反的) → 使从两个相反方向来 → 遇到

trans.tranOther: to experience something, especially problems or opposition
an occasion when you meet someone, or do something with someone you do not know
